Package database

Enum FilmDAOEnum

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Enum<FilmDAOEnum>
database.FilmDAOEnum
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<FilmDAOEnum>, java.lang.constant.Constable
public enum FilmDAOEnum extends Enum<FilmDAOEnum>
FilmDAOEnum
Since:
10/04/23
Version:
1.0
Author:
jordanprescott Singleton design pattern this Device Access Object (DAO) is used for interaction with the Database (DB). The structure follows the Create, Read, Update, Delete (CRUD) operations performed on a database and each method has been tagged with //{OPERATION} at the start to identify. Create : insertFilm() Read : getNextFilm(), getAllFilms(), getFilm() Update : updateFilm() Delete : deleteFilm

    • insertFilm

      public boolean insertFilm(Film f) throws SQLException
      insertFilm Takes parameter of Film object and uses details of Film to format an SQL query and then execute the query against the DB. This creates a single film entry in DB.
      Parameters:
      f - Film object
      Returns:
      Boolean of true to indicate completion
      Throws:
      SQLException - Throws error connection fails to the DB.

    • getAllFilms

      public ArrayList<Film> getAllFilms()
      getAllFilms Queries DB for all films and then loops through each entry creating local Film object and appending this to the array. The completed array of Film objects is then returned.
      Returns:
      filmsArray Array of Film objects built on DB response.

    • getFilm

      public Film getFilm(Film f)
      getFilm Takes a single parameter of a Film object and then uses the getId() format prepared statement SQL query. The query is then executed and a single Film object is returned from result set.
      Parameters:
      f - Film object
      Returns:
      oneFilm A single film from the results of the query

    • searchFilms

      public ArrayList<Film> searchFilms(String s)
      searchFilms Takes parameter of String s a SQL query and uses SQL OR to make string a dynamic query and then execute the query against the DB. This retrieves any films the OR statements have triggered true. For example you can search for director name or number of stars or the year and this will return everything found without needing to heavily format the query.
      Parameters:
      s - String that will be queried against DB.
      Returns:
      filmsArray List of films returned from query.

    • updateFilm

      public boolean updateFilm(Film f) throws SQLException
      updateFilm Takes parameter of Film object and uses details of Film to format an SQL query and then execute the query against the DB. This updates a film entry in DB.
      Parameters:
      f - Film object that will be updated in DB.
      Returns:
      b Boolean of true to indicate completion.
      Throws:
      SQLException - Throws error connection fails to the DB.

    • deleteFilm

      public boolean deleteFilm(int id) throws SQLException
      deleteFilm Takes parameter of id an Integer and uses details of Film to format an SQL query and then execute the query against the DB. This deletes a film entry in DB.
      Parameters:
      id - Integer id of film in DB.
      Returns:
      b Boolean of true to indicate completion.
      Throws:
      SQLException - Throws error connection fails to the DB.
